comments:
After closing eclipse (3.0M8 - Version: 3.0.0, Build id: 200403261517) the previous time in a given 
workspace, when eclipse complained about something (I don't recall the complaint), eclipse now hangs 
when opening the same workspace. Hang in this case also means that after asking for a workspace (I 
didn't set a default) and removing the splash screen, it stops responding. That includes that it won't 
respond to any of the few menu items the application presents (as seen in the picture I'm trying to 
attach showing a hanging eclipse), including the "About eclipse" item.

After running for 8 hours, thinking perhaps that it was just chugging away doing something, here's the 
state of eclipse:

I have been able to make progress by starting a new workspace and importing the projects into that 
workspace.
Created an attachment (id=10758)
Picture showing menubar of hanging eclipse
Created an attachment (id=10759)
eclipse running in new workspace, running normally
I have the same problem. I'm running 3.0 release version with JDK 1.4.2_04 
(same problem occurs with _05 as well). When I start eclipse it hangs some 
times. Some times I can continue by clicking on some of the views, which seem 
to "loosen" it up and I can continue normally. If it doesn't get "loosened" up, 
then it hangs atleast for 5 minutes (I haven't had the patience to wait longer 
than that).

The above problem only happens when I have a project without the package 
explorer tree open.

I have the following plugins in the eclipse installation with this problem :

* Exadel studio trial version
* Hibernate synchronizer
* Quantum DB
This has not been seen in awhile.  If someone gets a hang again with a 3.1
stream build, please provide a stack dump (kill -3 on the Java process pid).
